author: Rob Braxman Tech
description:
Microsoft is aggressively pushing Windows 11 into the Agentic-OS world where the AI doesn't just behave like a chatbot but does tasks for you. While this has explosive implications in the enterprise world, there is doubt that this has actually been figured out for personal use. In the enterprise world, the environment requires iterative testing, monitoring and human checks to verify the performance of an AI. But in the personal world, no such control exists. And yet, Microsoft is the sole company (not Apple, or Google) that is invoking AI with this kind of autonomy. Is Microsoft misfocused?

title: Microsoft's Agentic AI Push: Genius for Business or Disaster for Your Personal Computing?
